action.action-desc: Mr. Messmer (for himself, Mr. Moolenaar, Mrs. Hinson, and Mr. Harder of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to exclude child and dependent care services and payments from the rate used to compute overtime compensation.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Empowering Employer Child and Elder Care Solutions Act.

section.header: Exclusion of child care in computing overtime compensation

subsection.text: Section 7(e) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 207(e)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by inserting payments or reimbursements for child or dependent care services; after by the employer;;
in paragraph (7), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (8)(D)(ii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
the value of any child or dependent care services provided by an employer.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to overtime compensation required to be paid for workweeks beginning on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
